li.data-alt: Brookeland Faculty and Staff are ALL IN for the success of our students

p.span: Brookeland Faculty and Staff are ALL IN for the success of our students

p.style: text-align: center;
text-align: center;

p.span: In order to offer an educational opportunity for all of our students the following measure are being put into place.
Computer based programs will have links placed on our school website
These programs will meet the educational accommodations of our special population and general education students. Each program is self-paced and has a read aloud component.
Dyslexia Assignments will be posted on our Teacher’s Website as follows:
Grades K-1 – read a grade level book and write a detail over the material
Grades 2-5 read a grade level book and write one of the following: detail, summary, main idea.
Students in Dual Credit Classes will continue to check with Angelina College. The Distance Learning Lab will be open from 9:00am – 12:00pm Monday – Thursday with computers available for students
Teachers will be available Monday, March 23rd – Thursday, March 26th from 10:00am – 12:00pm to answer questions. (409) 698-2413 ext. 206

p.style: text-align: center;
text-align: center;

span.style: font-size: 22px; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; color: #0070c0;

strong.span: Third Grade Reading – Monday / Wednesday 3:30-4:30 starting February 3, 2020
Third Grade Math – Tuesday / Thursday 3:30-4:30 starting February 4, 2020
Fourth Grade Reading – Tuesday – January 28th – March 24th -- 3:25-4:25
Fifth Grade Reading – Wednesday – January 29th – April 1st – 3:25-4:25

text-align: center;

div.p: Tuesday, Feb 18: Pick-Line (2 NHS members will ask for donations in Pick up line before school)
Spring Basket Raffle (chances $1.00, basket displayed in office)
Start filling your banks for the class competition.
Thursday, Feb 20: PJ Day (pre-K thru 5 only) $1.00 Give your dollar to 1st period teacher
Friday, Feb 21: Hat Day (Entire Campus) $1.00
Purchase your sticker in the cafeteria before school or from Ms. MacLeod
Snack Sales (last 10 minutes of each lunch period)
Thursday, Feb 27: PJ Day (pre-K thru 5 only) $1.00 Give your dollar to 1st period teacher
Friday, Feb 28: Hat Day (Entire Campus) $1.00
Purchase your sticker in the cafeteria before school or from Ms. MacLeod
Snack Sales (last 10 minutes of each lunch period )
Monday, March 2: Classroom Competition Begins (winner receives trip and lunch to Olive Garden in Lufkin)
Wednesday, March 5: PJ Day (pre-K thru 5 only) $1.00 Give your dollar to 1st period teacher.
Thursday, March 6: Hat Day (Entire Campus) $1.00
Purchase your sticker in the cafeteria or from Ms. MacLeod
Snack Sales (last 10 minutes of each lunch period)
Friday, March 7: Bingo (Pineland Fire Department)
Raffle Drawing before BLACKOUT Bingo

div.a: Brookeland's Alana Coulter commits to East Texas Baptist

div.div: Alana Coulter, Senior at Brookeland Independent School District has signed to play soccer with East Texas Baptist University. Read full articual at https://www.kjas.com/news/local_news/article_6df04a9e-2bf2-11e9-a6af-f3dc6ff7b8dc.htmlRead more...

The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society (LLS) is the world s largest non-profit health organization dedicated to finding cures for blood cancers. Our Pennies for Patients program sponsored by the Brookeland High School NHS would like to support the LLSRead more...

div.a: New Construction Parent Drop Off and Pick up

div.div: To: Parents of Brookeland ISD Students From: Kevin McCugh / Superintendent Date: Monday, October 22, 2018 Due to building demolition / new construction, we are approaching the date where the front parking lot will not be accessible for student drop off in the mornings, or pick up after school. There...Read more...

p.style: text-align: center;

div.p: The staff of Brookeland ISD believes that ALL students can learn. We believe that our school’s purpose is to educate all students to high levels of academic performance while fostering positive growth in social/emotional behaviors and attitudes. We accept the responsibility to teach all students in a challenging, meaningful way that allows each child to become a literate, contributing adult. Brookeland ISD is a center for sound learning, academic discovery, and the pursuit of wisdom through advanced course offerings, high academic standards and aggressive, innovative instruction. The students of Brookeland ISD will excel and compete academically with any students in the country.

Brookeland Independent School District
187 Wildcat Walk
Brookeland, TX 75931-0008
Phone: (409) 698-2677
Fax: (409) 698-2533
Office Hours: 8:00am to 4:30pm M-F
